useGuidance: The unique key given to an imaging study record (often referred to as accession number or imaging order number)
etlConventions: Each instance of an imaging study present in the source data should be assigned this unique key.

useGuidance: The PERSON_ID of the PERSON for whom the procedure is recorded. This may be a system generated code.
The unique key given to a procedure record for a person. Refer to the ETL for how duplicate procedures during the same visit were handled.
etlConventions: Each instance of a procedure occurrence in the source data should be assigned this unique key. In some cases, a person can have multiple records of the same procedure within the same visit. It is valid to keep these duplicates and assign them individual, unique, PROCEDURE_OCCURRENCE_IDs, though it is up to the ETL how they should be handled.
A Web Access to DICOM Objects via Restful Web Services Uniform Resource Identifier. Study level UID.

useGuidance: Use this date to determine the date the imaging procedure occurred.
DICOM defined value (Eg US, CT, MR, PET, DR, CR, NUCMED)
Antomical location of the imaging procedure
etlConventions: Map the ANATOMIC_SITE_SOURCE_VALUE to a Standard Concept in the Spec Anatomic Site domain. This should be coded at the lowest level of granularity Accepted Concepts

useGuidance: The unique key given to an imaging feature.
etlConventions: An autonumber to identifier individual features of an image_OCCURRENCE

useGuidance: The PERSON_ID of the PERSON for whom the procedure is recorded. This may be a system generated code.
This field can be used to determine the provenance of the imaging features, e.g., radiology structured reports, algorithms used on images
etlConventions: Choose the IMAGE_FEATURE_TYPE_CONCEPT_ID that best represents the provenance of the record. Accepted Concepts. A more detailed explanation of each Type Concept can be found on the vocabulary wiki.

useGuidance: An identifier within and IMAGE_OCCURRENCE table that describes a clinical finding.
etlConventions: Can be set to 0 for acquisition parameters.  Can be used to link findings longitudinally with Episode_Events
The link to the images identified in the image_OCCURRENCE Table.
The domain the concept is stored in (MEASUREMENT, OBSERVATION, ...) Accepted Concepts (https://athena.ohdsi.org/search-terms/terms?conceptClass=Table&vocabulary=CDM&page=2&pageSize=15&query=)
The id number of the feature located in the clinical domain Tables.

useGuidance: This is the site on the body where the feature is located.
Name and version of the model that extracted the term.
etlConventions: Can be a URI locator to the algorithm with parameterization

useGuidance: The date and time of the algorithm processing.

etlConventions: Can be a URI locator to algorithm performance metrics
